generif.text: Application of neurosecretory protein VGF biomarker model to current diagnostic criteria provides an objective biomarker pattern that identifies patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

while Vgf may be a reliable biomarker of progression of muscle weakness in patients with ALS, restoration of Vgf expression in spinal cord motor neurons may therapeutically rescue spinal cord motorneurons against excitotoxic injury

VGF mRNA levels were significantly reduced in drug-free depressed patients, as compared with controls, and were modulated in response to effective antidepressant treatment.

VGF is downregulated in bipolar disorder in the CA region of the hippocampus and Brodmann's area 9 of the prefrontal cortex.
VGF is regulated by SOD1 and plays a critical role in motor neuron survival

[review] The vgf gene is induced in vivo by neurotrophins including nerve growth factor (NGF), brain derived growth factor (BDNF) and glial derived growth actor (GDNF), by synaptic activity and by homeostatic and other stimuli.

Knock-in mice expressing human VGF were fertile, had increased body weight, whereas those with c-terminal region deletion had reduced adiposity, increased energy expenditure, and improved glucose tolerance.
Data indicate an increased number of neurosecretory protein VGF-expressing T cells in patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD) compared to aged healthy controls.

Serum VGF levels were significantly lower in MDD patients but higher in BD patients compared with HC (both PTukey < 0.01). No correlation was found between serum VGF levels and any data of subjects.

H19 is a promising prognostic factor in Pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasms (pNENs) with malignant behaviors and functions as an oncogene via the VGF-mediated PI3K/AKT/CREB pathway. In addition, our study implies that VGF may also serve as a candidate prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in pNENs.

name: VGF nerve growth factor inducible

reactome.name: Nuclear Events (kinase and transcription factor activation)
Regulation of Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF) transport and uptake by Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding Proteins (IGFBPs)

summary: This gene is specifically expressed in a subpopulation of neuroendocrine cells, and is upregulated by nerve growth factor. The structural organization of this gene is similar to that of the rat gene, and both the translated and the untranslated regions show a high degree of sequence similarity to the rat gene. The encoded secretory protein also shares similarities with the secretogranin/chromogranin family, however, its exact function is not known. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
